conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the blocks and use Newton's second law of motion.
Block A: No external force is applied directly. Block B: A horizontal pulling force F is applied. Block C: Connected to block B by a light spring. Block D: No external force is applied directly.
All four blocks are accelerating together with the same acceleration, denoted as a.
Total mass of the system is 4m and net force is F. According to Newton's second law, F = 4ma.
Solve for the acceleration a: a = F / 4m.
Block D is not directly connected to the spring or the pulling force F.
The only horizontal force acting on block D is the static friction force f_s between block D and the surface.
Apply Newton's second law to block D: f_s = ma.
Substitute the value of a into the equation for f_s: f_s = m(F / 4m) = F / 4.
The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D during the acceleration process is F / 4.
